str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A heavy rain. From brecho; rain.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go down, come down, either from the sky or from higher land, descend. From kata and the base of basis; to descend.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A river, torrent, stream. Probably from a derivative of the alternate of pino; a current, brook or freshet, i.e. Running water.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To come, go.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To blow, breathe, as the wind. A primary word; to breathe hard, i.e. Breeze.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pros and kopto; to strike at, i.e. Surge against; specially, to stub on, i.e. Trip up.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
And, even, also, namely.
Large, great, in the widest sense.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A falling, a fall, ruin. From the alternate of pipto; a crash, i.e. Downfall.
